Adamant bolts are a ranged projectile which is the 4th strongest bolt in the game, and must be fired from an adamant crossbow or higher (requiring 46 Ranged).

A player with 55 Slayer and 61 Ranged may wish to instead use broad bolts, as these are equally strong, yet are considerably cheaper. However, broad bolts cannot be fired by an adamant crossbow and require a rune crossbow or higher to use.

Adamant bolts can be smithed at level 73 Smithing using an adamantite bar, creating 10 adamant bolts(unf) per bar. Level 61 Fletching is required to complete the bolts. When adding feathers, each ten bolts yields 70 experience. Players can also choose to attach diamond bolt tips at 65 Fletching or ruby bolt tips at 63 Fletching and enchant the bolts for added effects in combat.

They are an uncommon drop from iron dragons and skeletal wyverns, in addition to the Hallowed Sepulchre coffins, useful sources for Ironmen who lack the 73 Smithing. As described above they can then be made into ruby bolts (e), or diamond bolts (e), which are useful for boss fights.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
4 January 2018
(update)
  • The extra strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Adamant bolts(p+)" to "Adamant bolts (p+)".
  • The super strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Adamant bolts(p++)" to "Adamant bolts (p++)".
10 December 2014
(update)
  • The poisoned variant was renamed from "Addy bolts (p)" to "Adamant bolts (p)"
  • The extra strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Addy bolts(p+)" to "Adamant bolts(p+)".
  • The super strong poisoned variant was renamed from "Addy bolts(p++)" to "Adamant bolts(p++)".
4 – 29 January 2007
  • The value of unpoisoned bolts was increased from 48 to 58.
  • The value of poisoned variants was increased from 1 to 58.

'''Adamant bolts''' are a ranged projectile which is the 4th strongest [[bolt]] in the game, and must be fired from an [[adamant crossbow]] or higher (requiring 46 [[Ranged]]).

A player with 55 [[Slayer]] and 61 Ranged may wish to instead use [[broad bolts]], as these are equally strong, yet are considerably cheaper. However, broad bolts cannot be fired by an [[adamant crossbow]] and require a [[rune crossbow]] or higher to use.

Adamant bolts can be smithed at level 73 [[Smithing]] using an [[adamantite bar]], creating 10 [[adamant bolts(unf)]] per bar. Level 61 [[Fletching]] is required to complete the bolts. When adding [[feather]]s, each ten bolts yields 70 experience. Players can also choose to attach [[diamond bolt tips]] at 65 Fletching or [[ruby bolt tips]] at 63 Fletching and enchant the bolts for added effects in combat.

They are an uncommon drop from [[iron dragon]]s and [[Skeletal Wyvern|skeletal wyverns]], in addition to the [[Coffin (Hallowed Sepulchre)|Hallowed Sepulchre coffins]], useful sources for [[Ironmen]] who lack the 73 Smithing. As described above they can then be made into [[ruby bolts (e)]], or [[diamond bolts (e)]], which are useful for boss fights.
